subject: Tennis
lead_paragraph: Fabrice Santoro, the oldest singles player competing regularly on the ATP Tour, began what may be his last season Monday at the Qatar Open. Santoro, a 35-year-old Frenchman, beat Andreas Seppi of Italy, 6-4, 1-6, 6-2. Assuming that Santoro remains healthy before the Australian Open, which begins Jan. 14, he will break Andre Agassi’s record of playing in 61 Grand Slam events.
